intro: Metrosideros longifolia, commonly known as the New Zealand pohutukawa, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub that can grow up to 10 meters tall. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red flowers that bloom in clusters during the winter months. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a bluish-green hue. The tree is well adapted to coastal environments and is often found growing on rocky shores and cliffs.
